column4: is there a way to change the screen resolution of your terminal screen? (like tty1)
the tty's are actually a program called agetty
so you would want to man agetty and see how it deals with resolution and size and whatnot and then edit /etc/inittab's agetty commands
Nothing in man pages
well looking at my /etc/inittab, I see that it runs /sbin/agetty 38400, I have to imagine that the 38400 thing deals with something like that
I do not actually have a file named inittab
That's probably the baud rate
do "test -f /etc/inittab ; echo $?"
hmm well bad advice on my part then, not sure what controls that, might be the framebuffer? might be able to control it with grub
you got a 1, ok then /etc/inittab doesn't exist. That's kind of odd but ok. What resolution do you want?
Oh is it a 1? lol... anything with bigger dpi because the fonts are hard to read.
yeah it should have been a 0 or 1, 0 for exist, 1 for doesn't exist, but what resolution do you want
if it could be 1024x18??, it would be amazing.
I assume that was a typo? 1024x18?
ok edit /boot/grub/menu.lst and on the line that says kernel put a space after whatever is already on that line and add this: vga=775
that will change the framebuffer to that resolution, I imagine that the tty's inherit the framebuffers resolution but maybe not, just a thought
I'll try that, thanks
yeah reboot to see
Now the terminal won't even come up lol Stuck with a blinking cursor. I'll just deal with the weird font size.
there might be another way, just a stab really on my part.
